body_html:
Thanks for the suggestion.

I think it should work, though I would much prefer if Checkpoint.restore didn't do its own numbering and allowed the user to customize it (via a global_step arg) :)

Nevertheless, it seems good enough for me.
Quick question, do we still need to do a dummy pass to initialize the variables berfore restoring the saved weights?

Thanks again, upto the devs to decide whether to close this issue because the bug still remains in tfe.Saver

body:
Thanks for the suggestion.

I think it should work, though I would much prefer if `Checkpoint.restore` didn't do its own numbering and allowed the user to customize it (via a `global_step` arg) :)

Nevertheless, it seems good enough for me.
Quick question, do we still need to do a dummy pass to initialize the variables berfore restoring the saved weights?


Thanks again, upto the devs to decide whether to close this issue because the bug still remains in `tfe.Saver`
